Sentencas: Substituted SrCoO3 perovskites have been proposed as promising mixed ionic electronic conductors for a range of applications including intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs), electrolysers and thermochemical water splitting reactors for H-2 production.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: In this work we investigate the effect of sample exposure to water in substituted SrCoO3 powders and thin films and correlate it with the degradation of oxygen mobility and kinetics.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: SrCo0.95Sb0.05O3-delta (SCS) thin films have been deposited on different single crystal substrates by pulsed laser deposition (PLD).
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: After water cleaning and post annealing at 300 degrees C, the sample surface presented an increase of the SrO-surface species as observed by ex situ X-ray Photoemission Spectroscopy (XPS) analysis.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: This increase in SrO at the sample surface has also been confirmed by the Low Energy Ion Scattering (LEIS) technique on both SCS thin film and powder.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: Thermochemical water splitting experiments on SCS and SrCo0.95Mo0.05O3-delta (SCM) powder revealed a phase degradation under water oxidising conditions at high temperature with the formation of the trigonal phase Sr6Co5O15.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) analysis of SCS powder treated with water suggests that this phase degradation could already superficially start at Room Temperature (RT).
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: By isotope exchange depth profile experiments on SCS thin films, we were able to quantify the oxygen diffusivity in this SCS surface decomposed layer (D* = 5.1 x 10(-17)
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics

Sentencas: In the specific case of bulk powder, the effect of water superficial decomposition translates into a lower oxidation and reduction kinetics as demonstrated by comparative thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) studies.
Titulo: Analysis of H2O-induced surface degradation in SrCoO3-derivatives and its impact on redox kinetics
